Conclusions</h2>\n<p>In this paper, we perform a comprehensive strong lensing analysis of the galaxy cluster RXC J2248 based on HST imaging and new extensive VLT spectroscopy with the VIMOS and MUSE instruments. We also find an extended Ly<span class=\"simple-math\"><i>&#945;</i></span> emitter at redshift 3.118, which is one of the first cases identified of a multiply lensed &#8220;Ly<span class=\"simple-math\"><i>&#945;</i></span> blob&#8221;. We consider 22 lensing models with different mass model parametrization, samples of multiple images, and assumptions on the free parameters. We show that RXC J2248 is a massive cluster, which is particularly suitable for constraining the background geometry of the Universe with strong lensing modelling, because of its unique combination of a regular shape, a large number of multiple images spanning a wide redshift range, and a relatively modest presence of an intervening large-scale structure, as revealed by our spectroscopic survey. We show that the accuracy with which we reproduce the observed positions of the multiple images (<span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-eq724.png\"></span>) is such that the perturbing effect of mass structures along the line of sight needs to be taken properly into account for further improvements. Future work will also need to focus on reducing systematics in the total mass-light scaling relation of the sub-halo population and this can be achieved by using measured velocity dispersions of the BCG and other bright cluster galaxies (e.g. <a name=\"InR47\"></a><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#R47\">Monna et al. 2015</a>). The main results of this study can be summarized as follows: </p>\n<p>\n        <ul style=\"list-style-type: none;\">\n          <li>\n            1. \n            <p class=\"ligne\"> We reconstruct the observed positions of 38 multiple imagesfrom 14 different sources in the redshift range<span class=\"simple-math\">1.035&#8722;6.111</span> with an accuracy of <span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-eq672.png\"></span> in our reference model F2 (see Table <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#T4\">4</a>). </p>\n          </li>\n          <li>\n            2. \n            <p class=\"ligne\"> By testing different lensing models we show that the total mass density distribution in the centre (<span class=\"simple-math\"><i>R</i> &#8818; 300</span> kpc) of RXC J2248 is better represented by a PIEMD profile rather than a NFW. This is basically because of the existence of a significant core in the inner regions. </p>\n          </li>\n          <li>\n            3. \n            <p class=\"ligne\"> Owing to the wide redshift range of secure multiply lensed sources and the regular mass distribution of RXC J2248, we are able to significantly alleviate degeneracies when simultaneously fitting the background geometry of the Universe and the total mass distribution of the lens in our strong lensing analyses. We thus find in the strong lensing analyses only that <span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-eq726.png\"></span> and <span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-eq727.png\"></span>  for a flat <span class=\"simple-math\">&#923;</span>CDM model and <span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-eq728.png\"></span>  and <span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-eq729.png\"></span> for a Universe with free curvature but <span class=\"simple-math\"><i>w</i> = &#8722;1</span>. </p>\n          </li>\n          <li>\n            4. \n            <p class=\"ligne\"> We show that spectroscopic information is critical for a high-precision strong lensing model. The lack of spectroscopic measurements of the multiply lensed sources or the use of photometric redshifts can bias the results on the values of the cosmological parameters, although the impact on the estimate of the total mass of the lens is not very significant. Moreover, a wide redshift range of multiply lensed sources is also critical to increase the leverage on cosmology. </p>\n          </li>\n          <li>\n            5. \n            <p class=\"ligne\"> Simple simulations, aimed at estimating the impact of line-of-sight perturbers on the lens modelling, show that this effect can introduce a scatter of <span class=\"simple-math\">(0.3 &#177; 0.1)&#8243;</span> in the multiple image positions, which is of the same order of the statistical errors achieved by our models. </p>\n          </li>\n        </ul>\n      </p>\n<p>We anticipate that repeating this experiment on other CLASH-VLT clusters, with similar high-quality samples of multiple images, leads instead to very loose constraints on cosmological parameters in cases where the spectroscopic campaign reveals significant large-scale structures along the line of sight. This suggests that a more sophisticated treatment of the oberved line-of-sight effects is needed in the lensing models to overcome this fundamental limit of lensing techniques. This will be the subject of future papers. </p>\n    <hr width=\"30%\" align=\"left\">\n<div><div>\n<a name=\"FN10\"></a><sup>1</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">\n          <a href=\"http://www.stsci.edu/hst/campaigns/frontier-fields/\" target=\"_blank\">http://www.stsci.edu/hst/campaigns/frontier-fields/</a>\n        </p>\n</div></div>\n<div><div>\n<a name=\"FN11\"></a><sup>2</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">\n          <a href=\"http://www.inference.phy.cam.ac.uk/bayesys/\" target=\"_blank\">http://www.inference.phy.cam.ac.uk/bayesys/</a>\n        </p>\n</div></div>\n    <h2 class=\"sec\">\n<a name=\"ack\"></a>Acknowledgments</h2>\n<p>We thank the ESO User Support group for excellent support on the implementation of the Large Programme 186.A-0798. The CLASH Multi-Cycle Treasury Program is based on observations made with the NASA/ESA <i>Hubble </i>Space Telescope. This work made use of MUSE data taken under programme ID 60.A-9345(A), during the science verification period. The authors thank the referee Marceau Limousin for useful comments on this paper. G.B.C. is supported by the CAPES-ICRANET programme through the grant BEX 13946/13-7. C.G. and E.M. acknowledge support by VILLUM FONDEN Young Investigator Programme through grant No. 10123. We acknowledge support from PRIN-INAF 2014 1.05.01.94.02 (PI M. Nonino). A.Z. is supported by NASA through <i>Hubble </i>Fellowship grant #HST-HF2-51334.001-A awarded by STScI. </p>\n    <h2 class=\"sec\">\n<a name=\"ref\"></a>References</h2>\n    <div id=\"content\">\n        <ol class=\"references\">\n                    <li>\n                <a name=\"R1\"></a>Abell, G. A., et al. 2002, MNRAS, 330, L29\n\n                \n\t\t                                                            <a target=\"link_edps\" href=\"https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/#abs/2002MNRAS.330L..29E/abstract\">\n                                                    [NASA ADS]\n                                                </a>\n                                                                                <a target=\"link_edps\" href=\"https://doi.org/10.1046/j.1365-8711.2002.05215.x\">\n                                                    [CrossRef]\n                                                </a>\n                                    \t\t\n                \n                                    <a href=\"https://scholar.google.com/scholar_lookup?author=Efstathiou%2C+G.%2C+Moody%2C+S.%2C+Peacock%2C+J.+A.&journal=MNRAS&volume=330&issue=2&pages=L29&publication_year=2002&issn=00358711%2C13652966\">[Google&nbsp;Scholar]</a>\n                \n                \n                 <span class=\"Z3988\" title=\"\">\n                                    </span>\n\n                \n                            </li>\n                    <li>\n                <a name=\"R12\"></a>Eisenstein, D. W., et al. 2005, ApJ, 633, 560\n\n                \n\t\t                                                            <a target=\"link_edps\" href=\"https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/#abs/2005ApJ...633..560E/abstract\">\n                                                    [NASA ADS]\n                                                </a>\n                                                                                <a target=\"link_edps\" href=\"https://doi.org/10.1086/466512\">\n                                                    [CrossRef]\n                                                </a>\n                                    \t\t\n                \n                                    <a href=\"https://scholar.google.com/scholar_lookup?title=SDSS+Collaboration&author=Eisenstein%2C+D.+J.%2C+Zehavi%2C+I.%2C+Hogg%2C+D.+W.&journal=ApJ&volume=633&issue=2&pages=560-574&publication_year=2005&issn=0004-637X%2C1538-4357\">[Google&nbsp;Scholar]</a>\n                \n                \n                 <span class=\"Z3988\" title=\"\">\n                                    </span>\n\n                \n                            </li>\n                    <li>\n                <a name=\"R13\"></a>El\u00edasd\u00f3ttir, \u00c1., Limousin, M., Richard, J., et al. 2007, ArXiv e-prints [<a href=\"http://arxiv.org/abs/0710.5636\" target=\"_blank\">arXiv:0710.5636</a>]\n\n                \n\t\t                \t\t\n                \n                                    <a href=\"https://scholar.google.com/scholar_lookup?doi=10.1051%2F0004-6361%2F201527670\">[Google&nbsp;Scholar]</a>\n                \n                \n                 <span class=\"Z3988\" title=\"\">\n                                    </span>\n\n                \n                            </li>\n                    <li>\n                <a name=\"R14\"></a>Francis, P. J., Williger, G. M., Collins, N. statistical analysis for the strong lensing models of Table <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#T4\">4</a>.</p>\n            <div class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#T5\">In the text</a></div>\n</div></div>\n<h2 class=\"sec\">\n<a name=\"figs\"></a>All Figures</h2>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F1.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-fig1_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F1.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 1</span></a>\n            <p>Colour composite image of RXC J2248 obtained using the 16 HST/ACS and WFC3 filters. Spectroscopically confirmed multiple images are indicated in red; multiple images with no spectroscopic redshift in magenta. White circles indicate sources close to a cluster member, or possibly lensed by line-of-sight structures, or with not secure counter images. These last images are not used in the lens model. More information is provided in Table <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#T1\">1</a>. The blue circle shows the position of the BCG. The multiple image ID 14e is only used in the model F1-5th; see Table <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#T4\">4</a>.</p>\n          </td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#F1\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F2.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-fig2_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F2.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 2</span></a>\n            <p>Colour composite image of RXC J2248 overlaid with the <i>Chandra </i>X-ray contours in white (<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#R20\">G&#243;mez et al. 2012</a>). Red circles indicate the selected cluster members (see Sect. <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#S8\">3.1.2</a>). The magenta circle shows the second brightest cluster member, used as the reference for the normalization of the mass-to-light ratio of the cluster members, i.e. <span class=\"simple-math\"><i>L</i><sub>0</sub></span> in Eq. (<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#FD3\">3</a>).</p>\n          </td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#F2\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F3.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-fig3_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F3.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 3</span></a>\n              <p>VLT/VIMOS spectra of the multiple image systems. <i>Left panels</i>: HST cutouts, 10<span class=\"simple-math\">&#8242;&#8242;</span> across with the position of the VIMOS <span class=\"simple-math\">1&#8242;&#8242;</span>-wide slits and the image ID from Table <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#T1\">1</a>. The vertical lines indicate the CIII] doublet emission wavelengths of a source at redshift 1.837. The small panels show the circles with <span class=\"simple-math\">1&#8243;</span> (<i>top</i>) and <span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-eq302.png\"></span> (<i>bottom</i>) radius used to extract the two spectra. The flux is rescaled by a factor of <span class=\"simple-math\">10<sup>-18</sup> erg / s / cm<sup>2</sup>/&#197;</span>.</p>\n              </td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#F6\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F7.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-fig7_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F7.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 5</span></a>\n                <p>MUSE 1D spectra of the multiple images 20a and 20b. The vertical line indicates the Ly<span class=\"simple-math\"><i>&#945;</i></span> emission wavelength of a source at redshift 3.118. The <i>small panels </i>show the circles with <span class=\"simple-math\">1&#8243;</span> radius used to extract the two spectra. The flux is rescaled by a factor of <span class=\"simple-math\">10<sup>-18</sup> erg / s / cm<sup>2</sup>/&#197;</span>.</p>\n              </td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#F7\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F8.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-fig8_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F8.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 6</span></a>\n              <p>CLASH/HST colour cutouts (<span class=\"simple-math\">4&#8243;</span> wide) of all multiple images used in the reference model F2. Red circles (<span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-eq60.png\"></span> radius) indicate the observed positions while the yellow crosses the model-predicted positions. The multiple image ID 14e is shown in the HFF cutout and the best-fitting position (blue cross) is given by the model F1-5th.</p>\n            </td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#F8\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F9.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-fig9_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F9.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 6</span></a>\n              <p>continued.</p>\n            </td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#F9\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F10.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-fig10_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F10.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 7</span></a>\n              <p>Distribution of the displacement values of the multiple images (absolute values of the observed minus the reconstructed positions, see Eq. (<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#FD6\">6</a>)) obtained from our reference model F2 (solid blue line) and in previous works by <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#R46\">Monna et al.</a> (<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#R46\">2014</a>; green dashed) and <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#R28\">Johnson et al.</a> (<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#R28\">2014</a>; red long dashed), for the cluster RXC J2248.</p>\n            </td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#F10\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F11.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-fig11_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F11.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 8</span></a>\n              <p>Best-fit redshift values of the multiple image families compared with the spectroscopic, in blue, and photometric, in green, redshift values. The arrows indicate the unconstrained redshifts and the black line the relation <span class=\"simple-math\"><i>z</i><sub>spec,phot</sub> = <i>z</i><sub>best fit</sub></span>. We use the spectroscopic redshift value measured from the Ly<span class=\"simple-math\"><i>&#945;</i></span> blob for family 20.</p>\n            </td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#F11\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F12.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-fig12_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F12.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 9</span></a>\n              <p>Confidence regions for the redshifts values of the families with no spectroscopic confirmation. Red regions: the redshift values of the spectroscopically confirmed families are fixed. Grey regions: the redshift values of all families are left free. These correspond to models F2 and FZ2, respectively, in Table <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#T4\">4</a>. The contours represent the <span class=\"simple-math\">68%</span>, <span class=\"simple-math\">95.4%</span>, and <span class=\"simple-math\">99.7%</span> confidence levels.</p>\n            </td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#F12\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F13.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-fig13_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F13.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 10</span></a>\n              <p>Confidence levels (black lines) for the cosmological parameters of models W1 and W2 (<span class=\"simple-math\">&#937;<sub>m</sub> + &#937;<sub>&#923;</sub> = 1</span>, <i>top panels</i>) and L1 and L2 (<span class=\"simple-math\"><i>w</i> = &#8722;1</span>, <i>bottom panels</i>). <i>Left panels </i>refer to strong lensing models using only spectroscopic families (L1, W1); models in the <i>right panels </i>include all families (L2, W2). Red lines: contours from <i>Planck </i>Data Release 2 data. Blue regions: combined constraints. The yellow circles indicate the maximum likelihood peak in this projection.</p>\n            </td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#F13\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F14.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-fig14_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F14.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 11</span></a>\n              <p>Confidence regions of the free parameters in the model considering all multiple image families and varying <span class=\"simple-math\">&#937;<sub>m</sub></span> and <span class=\"simple-math\"><i>w</i></span> in a flat Universe (model W2). The contours represent the <span class=\"simple-math\">68%</span>, <span class=\"simple-math\">95.4%</span>, and <span class=\"simple-math\">99.7%</span> confidence levels. The lines indicate the maximum likelihood in the projection on each single parameter. Contours associated with constrained redshifts are omitted for clarity.</p>\n            </td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#F14\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F15.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-fig15_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F15.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 12</span></a>\n            <p>Confidence regions on the cosmological parameter planes when all multiple image systems are used with the exception of the highest redshift (<span class=\"simple-math\"><i>z</i> = 6.111</span>) family (<i>left</i>: model W3; <i>right</i>: model L3).</p>\n          </td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#F15\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n<div class=\"inset\"><table>\n<tr>\n<td valign=\"middle\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F16.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"thumbnail\" src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-fig16_small.jpg\"></a></td>\n<td class=\"img-txt\">\n<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/F16.html\" target=\"_blank\"><span class=\"bold\">Fig. 13</span></a>\n            <p><i>Left</i><i> panel</i>: probability distribution function, obtained from the set of 20 simulations, of the <span class=\"simple-math\">&#916;<sub>rms</sub></span> offset between the perturbed and best-fitting model-predicted positions of the 24 multiple images. The predicted positions are determined by optimizing the parameters of the total mass distribution of the main lens not including the mass perturbers along the line-of-sight. <i>Middle and right panels</i>: best-fitting values of the parameters <span class=\"simple-math\">&#937;<sub>m</sub></span>, <span class=\"simple-math\">&#937;<sub>&#923;</sub></span> and <span class=\"simple-math\"><i>w</i></span> from the set of 20 simulations. These values are determined by optimizing the parameters of the total mass distribution of the main lens and of the cosmological model not including in the mass perturbers along the line-of-sight.</p>\n          </td>\n</tr>\n<tr><td colspan=\"2\" class=\"in-txt\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#F16\">In the text</a></td></tr>\n</table></div>\n</div>\n\n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201527670\" data-edps_ref=\"aa27670-15\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. Seitz\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University Observatory Munich, Scheinerstrasse 1, 81679 Munich, Germany\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Max Planck Institute for Extraterrestrial Physics, Giessenbachstrasse, 85748 Garching, Germany\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"E. Vanzella\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"INAF\u2013Osservatorio Astronomico di Bologna, via Ranzani 1, 40127 Bologna, Italy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"B. Ziegler\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, T\u00fcrkenschanzstr. 17, 1180 Wien, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"CLASH-VLT: A highly precise strong lensing model of the galaxy cluster RXC J2248.7\u22124431 (Abell S1063) and prospects for cosmography\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2016/02/22\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2016/03/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"587\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A80\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201527670\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2016A%26A...587A..80C\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2016/03/aa27670-15.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: individual: RXC J2248.7-4431\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"cosmological parameters\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"dark matter\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Aims. &lt;i/&gt;We perform a comprehensive study of the total mass distribution of the galaxy cluster RXC J2248.7\u22124431 (&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 0.348) with a set of high-precision strong lensing models, which take advantage of extensive spectroscopic information on many multiply lensed systems. In the effort to understand and quantify inherent systematics in parametric strong lensing modelling, we explore a collection of 22 models in which we use different samples of multiple image families, different parametrizations of the mass distribution and cosmological parameters.&lt;i&gt;Methods. &lt;i/&gt;As input information for the strong lensing models, we use the Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble &lt;i/&gt;(CLASH) imaging data and spectroscopic follow-up observations, with the VIsible Multi-Object Spectrograph (VIMOS) and Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE) on the Very Large Telescope (VLT), to identify and characterize bona fide multiple image families and measure their redshifts down to &lt;i&gt;m&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;F814W&lt;sub/&gt; \u2243 26. A total of 16 background sources, over the redshift range 1.0\u22126.1, are multiply lensed into 47 images, 24 of which are spectroscopically confirmed and belong to ten individual sources. These also include a multiply lensed Lyman-&lt;i&gt;\u03b1&lt;i/&gt; blob at &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 3.118. The cluster total mass distribution and underlying cosmology in the models are optimized by matching the observed positions of the multiple images on the lens plane. Bayesian Markov chain Monte Carlo techniques are used to quantify errors and covariances of the best-fit parameters.&lt;i&gt;Results. &lt;i/&gt;We show that with a careful selection of a large sample of spectroscopically confirmed multiple images, the best-fit model can reproduce their observed positions with a rms scatter of 0.\u030b3 in a fixed flat \u039bCDM cosmology, whereas the lack of spectroscopic information or the use of inaccurate photometric redshifts can lead to biases in the values of the model parameters. We find that the best-fit parametrization for the cluster total mass distribution is composed of an elliptical pseudo-isothermal mass distribution with a significant core for the overall cluster halo and truncated pseudo-isothermal mass profiles for the cluster galaxies. We show that by adding bona fide photometric-selected multiple images to the sample of spectroscopic families, one can slightly improve constraints on the model parameters. In particular, we find that the degeneracy between the lens total mass distribution and the underlying geometry of the Universe, which is probed via angular diameter distance ratios between the lens and sources and the observer and sources, can be partially removed. Allowing cosmological parameters to vary together with the cluster parameters, we find (at 68% confidence level) \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.25&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.13&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.16&lt;sub/&gt; and &lt;i&gt;w&lt;i/&gt; = \u22121.07&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.16&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.42&lt;sub/&gt; for a flat \u039bCDM model, and \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.31&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.12&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.13&lt;sub/&gt; and \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;\u039b&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.38&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.38&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.27&lt;sub/&gt; for a Universe with &lt;i&gt;w&lt;i/&gt; = \u22121 and free curvature. Finally, using toy models mimicking the overall configuration of multiple images and cluster total mass distribution, we estimate the impact of the line-of-sight mass structure on the positional rms to be 0.\u030b3 \u00b1 0. We argue that the apparent sensitivity of our lensing model to cosmography is due to the combination of the regular potential shape of RXC J2248, a large number of bona fide multiple images out to &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 6.1, and a relatively modest presence of intervening large-scale structure, as revealed by our spectroscopic survey.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Coordena\u00e7\u00e3o de Aperfei\u00e7oamento de Pessoal de N\u00edvel Superior; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100002322; citation_grant_number=13946/13-7;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Villum Fonden; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/100008398; citation_grant_number=10123;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Financiadora de Estudos e Projetos; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100004809; citation_grant_number=01.07.0515.00;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Funda\u00e7\u00e3o Carlos Chagas Filho de Amparo \u00e0 Pesquisa do Estado do Rio de Janeiro; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100004586; citation_grant_number=E-26/171.206/2006; citation_grant_number=E-26/110.516/2012;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Istituto Nazionale di Astrofisica; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100005184; citation_grant_number=1.05.01.94.02;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=National Aeronautics and Space Administration; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/100000104; citation_grant_number=#HST-HF2-51334.001-A;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=G. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div </table></div><div class=\"history\">\n              <p><b>Notes.</b> Properties of the multiple images. The coordinates correspond to the luminosity peak used in the strong lensing models. Best-fit redshifts and magnifications with 68% confidence level errors (columns <span class=\"simple-math\"><i>z</i><sub>model</sub></span> and <span class=\"simple-math\"><i>&#956;</i></span>, respectively) are computed using the model F2 (see Sect. <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#S12\">4</a>). Observed magnitudes in the <i>F814W </i>filter (<span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-eq240.png\" width=\"37\" height=\"18\" /></span>) are Kron magnitudes measured with <i>SExtractor</i>. In the last column, the unlensed magnitudes <span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-eq241.png\" width=\"56\" height=\"18\" /></span> are shown.  </p>\n              <div><a name=\"TFN3\" id=\"TFN3\"></a><sup>(*)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Multiple images close to a cluster member, or possibly lensed by LOS structures, or not secure counter image (not used in the model).</p></div>\n              <div><a name=\"TFN4\" id=\"TFN4\"></a><sup>(&#8224;)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">Magnification given by the model ID F2a. For family 11, we quote the values at the model-predicted positions (see text for details).</p></div>\n              <p>\n                <b>Reference. </b>\n              </p>\n              <div><a name=\"TFN5\" id=\"TFN5\"></a><sup>(a)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\">This work.</p></div>\n              <div><a name=\"TFN6\" id=\"TFN6\"></a><sup>(b)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#R4\">Balestra et al. (2013)</a>. Independent redshift measuremenst by:</p></div>\n              <div><a name=\"TFN7\" id=\"TFN7\"></a><sup>(c)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\"><a name=\"InR7\" id=\"InR7\"></a><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#R7\">Boone et al. (2013)</a>;</p></div>\n              <div><a name=\"TFN8\" id=\"TFN8\"></a><sup>(d)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#R56\">Richard et al. (2014)</a>;</p></div>\n              <div><a name=\"TFN9\" id=\"TFN9\"></a><sup>(e)</sup> <p class=\"ligne\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#R32\">Karman et al. (2015)</a>.</p></div>\n            </div></div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201527670\" data-edps_ref=\"aa27670-15\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico ico-info\"></span>\n\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t<p>Initial download of the metrics may take a while.</p>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\n\n</div>\n\n\n\n\n</div>\n<script type=\"text/javascript\" Ziegler\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, T\u00fcrkenschanzstr. 17, 1180 Wien, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"CLASH-VLT: A highly precise strong lensing model of the galaxy cluster RXC J2248.7\u22124431 (Abell S1063) and prospects for cosmography\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2016/02/22\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2016/03/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"587\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A80\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201527670\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2016A%26A...587A..80C\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2016/03/aa27670-15.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: individual: RXC J2248.7-4431\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"cosmological parameters\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"dark matter\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Aims. &lt;i/&gt;We perform a comprehensive study of the total mass distribution of the galaxy cluster RXC J2248.7\u22124431 (&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 0.348) with a set of high-precision strong lensing models, which take advantage of extensive spectroscopic information on many multiply lensed systems. In the effort to understand and quantify inherent systematics in parametric strong lensing modelling, we explore a collection of 22 models in which we use different samples of multiple image families, different parametrizations of the mass distribution and cosmological parameters.&lt;i&gt;Methods. &lt;i/&gt;As input information for the strong lensing models, we use the Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble &lt;i/&gt;(CLASH) imaging data and spectroscopic follow-up observations, with the VIsible Multi-Object Spectrograph (VIMOS) and Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE) on the Very Large Telescope (VLT), to identify and characterize bona fide multiple image families and measure their redshifts down to &lt;i&gt;m&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;F814W&lt;sub/&gt; \u2243 26. A total of 16 background sources, over the redshift range 1.0\u22126.1, are multiply lensed into 47 images, 24 of which are spectroscopically confirmed and belong to ten individual sources. These also include a multiply lensed Lyman-&lt;i&gt;\u03b1&lt;i/&gt; blob at &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 3.118. The cluster total mass distribution and underlying cosmology in the models are optimized by matching the observed positions of the multiple images on the lens plane. Bayesian Markov chain Monte Carlo techniques are used to quantify errors and covariances of the best-fit parameters.&lt;i&gt;Results. &lt;i/&gt;We show that with a careful selection of a large sample of spectroscopically confirmed multiple images, the best-fit model can reproduce their observed positions with a rms scatter of 0.\u030b3 in a fixed flat \u039bCDM cosmology, whereas the lack of spectroscopic information or the use of inaccurate photometric redshifts can lead to biases in the values of the model parameters. We find that the best-fit parametrization for the cluster total mass distribution is composed of an elliptical pseudo-isothermal mass distribution with a significant core for the overall cluster halo and truncated pseudo-isothermal mass profiles for the cluster galaxies. We show that by adding bona fide photometric-selected multiple images to the sample of spectroscopic families, one can slightly improve constraints on the model parameters. In particular, we find that the degeneracy between the lens total mass distribution and the underlying geometry of the Universe, which is probed via angular diameter distance ratios between the lens and sources and the observer and sources, can be partially removed. Allowing cosmological parameters to vary together with the cluster parameters, we find (at 68% confidence level) \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.25&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.13&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.16&lt;sub/&gt; and &lt;i&gt;w&lt;i/&gt; = \u22121.07&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.16&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.42&lt;sub/&gt; for a flat \u039bCDM model, and \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.31&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.12&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.13&lt;sub/&gt; and \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;\u039b&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.38&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.38&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.27&lt;sub/&gt; for a Universe with &lt;i&gt;w&lt;i/&gt; = \u22121 and free curvature. Finally, using toy models mimicking the overall configuration of multiple images and cluster total mass distribution, we estimate the impact of the line-of-sight mass structure on the positional rms to be 0.\u030b3 \u00b1 0. We argue that the apparent sensitivity of our lensing model to cosmography is due to the combination of the regular potential shape of RXC J2248, a large number of bona fide multiple images out to &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 6.1, and a relatively modest presence of intervening large-scale structure, as revealed by our spectroscopic survey.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Coordena\u00e7\u00e3o de Aperfei\u00e7oamento de Pessoal de N\u00edvel Superior; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100002322; citation_grant_number=13946/13-7;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Villum Fonden; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/100008398; citation_grant_number=10123;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Financiadora de Estudos e Projetos; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100004809; citation_grant_number=01.07.0515.00;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Funda\u00e7\u00e3o Carlos Chagas Filho de Amparo \u00e0 Pesquisa do Estado do Rio de Janeiro; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100004586; citation_grant_number=E-26/171.206/2006; citation_grant_number=E-26/110.516/2012;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Istituto Nazionale di Astrofisica; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100005184; citation_grant_number=1.05.01.94.02;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=National Aeronautics and Space Administration; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/100000104; citation_grant_number=#HST-HF2-51334.001-A;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=G. O. Abell;citation_author=H. G. Corwin;citation_author=R. P. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div align=\"center\"></td>\n              </tr>\n            </table></div><div class=\"history\">\n              <p><b>Notes.</b> IDs correspond to the models in the Table <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#T4\">4</a>. For the models FZ1 and FZ2 the best-fit redshift values of the families 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 14 and 18 are omitted to improve visualisation. The values of all velocity dispersions (<span class=\"simple-math\"><i>&#963;</i><sub>v</sub></span>) are corrected by the factor <span class=\"img-inline\"><img src=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15-eq664.png\" width=\"29\" height=\"15\" /></span> as described in the <i>lenstool </i>manual (see <a href=\"http://projets.lam.fr/projects/lenstool/wiki/PIEMD\" target=\"_blank\">http://projets.lam.fr/projects/lenstool/wiki/PIEMD</a>).</p>\n            </div></div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201527670\" data-edps_ref=\"aa27670-15\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico Ziegler\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, T\u00fcrkenschanzstr. 17, 1180 Wien, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"CLASH-VLT: A highly precise strong lensing model of the galaxy cluster RXC J2248.7\u22124431 (Abell S1063) and prospects for cosmography\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2016/02/22\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2016/03/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"587\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A80\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201527670\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2016A%26A...587A..80C\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2016/03/aa27670-15.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: individual: RXC J2248.7-4431\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"cosmological parameters\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"dark matter\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Aims. &lt;i/&gt;We perform a comprehensive study of the total mass distribution of the galaxy cluster RXC J2248.7\u22124431 (&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 0.348) with a set of high-precision strong lensing models, which take advantage of extensive spectroscopic information on many multiply lensed systems. In the effort to understand and quantify inherent systematics in parametric strong lensing modelling, we explore a collection of 22 models in which we use different samples of multiple image families, different parametrizations of the mass distribution and cosmological parameters.&lt;i&gt;Methods. &lt;i/&gt;As input information for the strong lensing models, we use the Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble &lt;i/&gt;(CLASH) imaging data and spectroscopic follow-up observations, with the VIsible Multi-Object Spectrograph (VIMOS) and Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE) on the Very Large Telescope (VLT), to identify and characterize bona fide multiple image families and measure their redshifts down to &lt;i&gt;m&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;F814W&lt;sub/&gt; \u2243 26. A total of 16 background sources, over the redshift range 1.0\u22126.1, are multiply lensed into 47 images, 24 of which are spectroscopically confirmed and belong to ten individual sources. These also include a multiply lensed Lyman-&lt;i&gt;\u03b1&lt;i/&gt; blob at &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 3.118. The cluster total mass distribution and underlying cosmology in the models are optimized by matching the observed positions of the multiple images on the lens plane. Bayesian Markov chain Monte Carlo techniques are used to quantify errors and covariances of the best-fit parameters.&lt;i&gt;Results. &lt;i/&gt;We show that with a careful selection of a large sample of spectroscopically confirmed multiple images, the best-fit model can reproduce their observed positions with a rms scatter of 0.\u030b3 in a fixed flat \u039bCDM cosmology, whereas the lack of spectroscopic information or the use of inaccurate photometric redshifts can lead to biases in the values of the model parameters. We find that the best-fit parametrization for the cluster total mass distribution is composed of an elliptical pseudo-isothermal mass distribution with a significant core for the overall cluster halo and truncated pseudo-isothermal mass profiles for the cluster galaxies. We show that by adding bona fide photometric-selected multiple images to the sample of spectroscopic families, one can slightly improve constraints on the model parameters. In particular, we find that the degeneracy between the lens total mass distribution and the underlying geometry of the Universe, which is probed via angular diameter distance ratios between the lens and sources and the observer and sources, can be partially removed. Allowing cosmological parameters to vary together with the cluster parameters, we find (at 68% confidence level) \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.25&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.13&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.16&lt;sub/&gt; and &lt;i&gt;w&lt;i/&gt; = \u22121.07&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.16&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.42&lt;sub/&gt; for a flat \u039bCDM model, and \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.31&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.12&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.13&lt;sub/&gt; and \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;\u039b&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.38&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.38&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.27&lt;sub/&gt; for a Universe with &lt;i&gt;w&lt;i/&gt; = \u22121 and free curvature. Finally, using toy models mimicking the overall configuration of multiple images and cluster total mass distribution, we estimate the impact of the line-of-sight mass structure on the positional rms to be 0.\u030b3 \u00b1 0. We argue that the apparent sensitivity of our lensing model to cosmography is due to the combination of the regular potential shape of RXC J2248, a large number of bona fide multiple images out to &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 6.1, and a relatively modest presence of intervening large-scale structure, as revealed by our spectroscopic survey.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Coordena\u00e7\u00e3o de Aperfei\u00e7oamento de Pessoal de N\u00edvel Superior; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100002322; citation_grant_number=13946/13-7;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Villum Fonden; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/100008398; citation_grant_number=10123;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Financiadora de Estudos e Projetos; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100004809; citation_grant_number=01.07.0515.00;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Funda\u00e7\u00e3o Carlos Chagas Filho de Amparo \u00e0 Pesquisa do Estado do Rio de Janeiro; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100004586; citation_grant_number=E-26/171.206/2006; citation_grant_number=E-26/110.516/2012;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Istituto Nazionale di Astrofisica; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100005184; citation_grant_number=1.05.01.94.02;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=National Aeronautics and Space Administration; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/100000104; citation_grant_number=#HST-HF2-51334.001-A;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=G. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div align=\"center\"></td>\n            </tr>\n          </table></div><div class=\"history\">\n            <p><b>Notes.</b> List of significantly magnified sources (<span class=\"simple-math\"><i>&#956;</i>&gt; 2</span>) with reliable redshift measurements (QF <span class=\"simple-math\">&gt; 1</span>). The magnifications and errors are computed from 20&#8201;000 random realizations of the model with fixed cosmology (ID F2, see Table <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html#T4\">4</a>). </p>\n          </div></div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201527670\" data-edps_ref=\"aa27670-15\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico ico-info\"></span>\n\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t<p>Initial download of the metrics may take a while.</p>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\n\n</div>\n\n\n\n\n</div>\n<script type=\"text/javascript\" Ziegler\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, T\u00fcrkenschanzstr. 17, 1180 Wien, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"CLASH-VLT: A highly precise strong lensing model of the galaxy cluster RXC J2248.7\u22124431 (Abell S1063) and prospects for cosmography\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2016/02/22\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2016/03/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"587\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A80\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201527670\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2016A%26A...587A..80C\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2016/03/aa27670-15.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: individual: RXC J2248.7-4431\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"cosmological parameters\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"dark matter\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Aims. &lt;i/&gt;We perform a comprehensive study of the total mass distribution of the galaxy cluster RXC J2248.7\u22124431 (&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 0.348) with a set of high-precision strong lensing models, which take advantage of extensive spectroscopic information on many multiply lensed systems. In the effort to understand and quantify inherent systematics in parametric strong lensing modelling, we explore a collection of 22 models in which we use different samples of multiple image families, different parametrizations of the mass distribution and cosmological parameters.&lt;i&gt;Methods. &lt;i/&gt;As input information for the strong lensing models, we use the Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble &lt;i/&gt;(CLASH) imaging data and spectroscopic follow-up observations, with the VIsible Multi-Object Spectrograph (VIMOS) and Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE) on the Very Large Telescope (VLT), to identify and characterize bona fide multiple image families and measure their redshifts down to &lt;i&gt;m&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;F814W&lt;sub/&gt; \u2243 26. A total of 16 background sources, over the redshift range 1.0\u22126.1, are multiply lensed into 47 images, 24 of which are spectroscopically confirmed and belong to ten individual sources. These also include a multiply lensed Lyman-&lt;i&gt;\u03b1&lt;i/&gt; blob at &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 3.118. The cluster total mass distribution and underlying cosmology in the models are optimized by matching the observed positions of the multiple images on the lens plane. Bayesian Markov chain Monte Carlo techniques are used to quantify errors and covariances of the best-fit parameters.&lt;i&gt;Results. &lt;i/&gt;We show that with a careful selection of a large sample of spectroscopically confirmed multiple images, the best-fit model can reproduce their observed positions with a rms scatter of 0.\u030b3 in a fixed flat \u039bCDM cosmology, whereas the lack of spectroscopic information or the use of inaccurate photometric redshifts can lead to biases in the values of the model parameters. We find that the best-fit parametrization for the cluster total mass distribution is composed of an elliptical pseudo-isothermal mass distribution with a significant core for the overall cluster halo and truncated pseudo-isothermal mass profiles for the cluster galaxies. We show that by adding bona fide photometric-selected multiple images to the sample of spectroscopic families, one can slightly improve constraints on the model parameters. In particular, we find that the degeneracy between the lens total mass distribution and the underlying geometry of the Universe, which is probed via angular diameter distance ratios between the lens and sources and the observer and sources, can be partially removed. Allowing cosmological parameters to vary together with the cluster parameters, we find (at 68% confidence level) \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.25&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.13&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.16&lt;sub/&gt; and &lt;i&gt;w&lt;i/&gt; = \u22121.07&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.16&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.42&lt;sub/&gt; for a flat \u039bCDM model, and \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.31&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.12&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.13&lt;sub/&gt; and \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;\u039b&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.38&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.38&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.27&lt;sub/&gt; for a Universe with &lt;i&gt;w&lt;i/&gt; = \u22121 and free curvature. Finally, using toy models mimicking the overall configuration of multiple images and cluster total mass distribution, we estimate the impact of the line-of-sight mass structure on the positional rms to be 0.\u030b3 \u00b1 0. We argue that the apparent sensitivity of our lensing model to cosmography is due to the combination of the regular potential shape of RXC J2248, a large number of bona fide multiple images out to &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 6.1, and a relatively modest presence of intervening large-scale structure, as revealed by our spectroscopic survey.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Coordena\u00e7\u00e3o de Aperfei\u00e7oamento de Pessoal de N\u00edvel Superior; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100002322; citation_grant_number=13946/13-7;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Villum Fonden; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/100008398; citation_grant_number=10123;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Financiadora de Estudos e Projetos; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100004809; citation_grant_number=01.07.0515.00;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Funda\u00e7\u00e3o Carlos Chagas Filho de Amparo \u00e0 Pesquisa do Estado do Rio de Janeiro; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100004586; citation_grant_number=E-26/171.206/2006; citation_grant_number=E-26/110.516/2012;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Istituto Nazionale di Astrofisica; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100005184; citation_grant_number=1.05.01.94.02;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=National Aeronautics and Space Administration; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/100000104; citation_grant_number=#HST-HF2-51334.001-A;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=G. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div file)</a></li></ul></li><li class=\"item-178 deeper parent\"><span class=\"separator\">LaTeX issues</span>\n<ul><li class=\"item-370\"><a class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico Maier\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, T\u00fcrkenschanzstr. 17, 1180 Wien, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"A. Monna\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University Observatory Munich, Scheinerstrasse 1, 81679 Munich, Germany\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Max Planck Institute for Extraterrestrial Physics, Giessenbachstrasse, 85748 Garching, Germany\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"M. Postman\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Space Telescope Science Institute, 3700 San Martin Drive, Baltimore, MD 21208, USA\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"B. Tiepolo 11, 34143 Trieste, Italy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"S. Seitz\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University Observatory Munich, Scheinerstrasse 1, 81679 Munich, Germany\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Max Planck Institute for Extraterrestrial Physics, Giessenbachstrasse, 85748 Garching, Germany\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"E. Vanzella\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"INAF\u2013Osservatorio Astronomico di Bologna, via Ranzani 1, 40127 Bologna, Italy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"B. Ziegler\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"University of Vienna, Department of Astrophysics, T\u00fcrkenschanzstr. 17, 1180 Wien, Austria\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"CLASH-VLT: A highly precise strong lensing model of the galaxy cluster RXC J2248.7\u22124431 (Abell S1063) and prospects for cosmography\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2016/02/22\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2016/03/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"587\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A80\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/201527670\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2016A%26A...587A..80C\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2016/03/aa27670-15/aa27670-15.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2016/03/aa27670-15.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: individual: RXC J2248.7-4431\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"cosmological parameters\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"dark matter\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Aims. &lt;i/&gt;We perform a comprehensive study of the total mass distribution of the galaxy cluster RXC J2248.7\u22124431 (&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 0.348) with a set of high-precision strong lensing models, which take advantage of extensive spectroscopic information on many multiply lensed systems. In the effort to understand and quantify inherent systematics in parametric strong lensing modelling, we explore a collection of 22 models in which we use different samples of multiple image families, different parametrizations of the mass distribution and cosmological parameters.&lt;i&gt;Methods. &lt;i/&gt;As input information for the strong lensing models, we use the Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble &lt;i/&gt;(CLASH) imaging data and spectroscopic follow-up observations, with the VIsible Multi-Object Spectrograph (VIMOS) and Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE) on the Very Large Telescope (VLT), to identify and characterize bona fide multiple image families and measure their redshifts down to &lt;i&gt;m&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;F814W&lt;sub/&gt; \u2243 26. A total of 16 background sources, over the redshift range 1.0\u22126.1, are multiply lensed into 47 images, 24 of which are spectroscopically confirmed and belong to ten individual sources. These also include a multiply lensed Lyman-&lt;i&gt;\u03b1&lt;i/&gt; blob at &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 3.118. The cluster total mass distribution and underlying cosmology in the models are optimized by matching the observed positions of the multiple images on the lens plane. Bayesian Markov chain Monte Carlo techniques are used to quantify errors and covariances of the best-fit parameters.&lt;i&gt;Results. &lt;i/&gt;We show that with a careful selection of a large sample of spectroscopically confirmed multiple images, the best-fit model can reproduce their observed positions with a rms scatter of 0.\u030b3 in a fixed flat \u039bCDM cosmology, whereas the lack of spectroscopic information or the use of inaccurate photometric redshifts can lead to biases in the values of the model parameters. We find that the best-fit parametrization for the cluster total mass distribution is composed of an elliptical pseudo-isothermal mass distribution with a significant core for the overall cluster halo and truncated pseudo-isothermal mass profiles for the cluster galaxies. We show that by adding bona fide photometric-selected multiple images to the sample of spectroscopic families, one can slightly improve constraints on the model parameters. In particular, we find that the degeneracy between the lens total mass distribution and the underlying geometry of the Universe, which is probed via angular diameter distance ratios between the lens and sources and the observer and sources, can be partially removed. Allowing cosmological parameters to vary together with the cluster parameters, we find (at 68% confidence level) \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.25&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.13&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.16&lt;sub/&gt; and &lt;i&gt;w&lt;i/&gt; = \u22121.07&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.16&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.42&lt;sub/&gt; for a flat \u039bCDM model, and \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.31&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.12&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.13&lt;sub/&gt; and \u03a9&lt;sub&gt;\u039b&lt;sub/&gt; = 0.38&lt;sup&gt;+ 0.38&lt;sup/&gt;&lt;sub&gt;-0.27&lt;sub/&gt; for a Universe with &lt;i&gt;w&lt;i/&gt; = \u22121 and free curvature. Finally, using toy models mimicking the overall configuration of multiple images and cluster total mass distribution, we estimate the impact of the line-of-sight mass structure on the positional rms to be 0.\u030b3 \u00b1 0. We argue that the apparent sensitivity of our lensing model to cosmography is due to the combination of the regular potential shape of RXC J2248, a large number of bona fide multiple images out to &lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt; = 6.1, and a relatively modest presence of intervening large-scale structure, as revealed by our spectroscopic survey.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Coordena\u00e7\u00e3o de Aperfei\u00e7oamento de Pessoal de N\u00edvel Superior; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100002322; citation_grant_number=13946/13-7;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Villum Fonden; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/100008398; citation_grant_number=10123;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Financiadora de Estudos e Projetos; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100004809; citation_grant_number=01.07.0515.00;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Funda\u00e7\u00e3o Carlos Chagas Filho de Amparo \u00e0 Pesquisa do Estado do Rio de Janeiro; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100004586; citation_grant_number=E-26/171.206/2006; citation_grant_number=E-26/110.516/2012;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=Istituto Nazionale di Astrofisica; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/501100005184; citation_grant_number=1.05.01.94.02;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=National Aeronautics and Space Administration; citation_funder_id=http://dx.doi.org/10.13039/100000104; citation_grant_number=#HST-HF2-51334.001-A;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=G. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div families</td>\n                </tr>\n                <tr>\n                  <td align=\"left\"> FZ1</td>\n                  <td align=\"center\">9</td>\n                  <td
